summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Nicholas Tartaglione. It charges him with multiple counts related to a drug trafficking conspiracy, the kidnapping and murder of four individuals (Martin Luna, Urbano Santiago, Miguel Luna, and Hector Gutierrez) in April 2016, and the use of firearms in furtherance of these crimes. The document details the specific events and locations of the alleged crimes. This document is a superseding indictment filing from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York against defendant Nicholas Tartaglione. It details the statutory aggravating factors supporting the government's intent to seek the death penalty for charges including murder and kidnapping resulting in death related to a drug trafficking crime.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: The defendant charged with multiple crimes including murder through use of a firearm in furtherance of a drug trafficking crime and kidnapping resulting in death. The document outlines statutory aggravating factors for seeking the death penalty against him.

persons.name: Martin Luna
persons.context: One of the four murder victims. He was allegedly lured to the Likquid Lounge by Tartaglione and others, confined, and killed.

persons.name: Urbano Santiago
persons.context: One of the four murder victims. He accompanied Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge, was held captive, transported to 419 Old Mountain Road, and killed.

persons.name: Miguel Luna
persons.context: One of the four murder victims. He accompanied Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge, was held captive, transported to 419 Old Mountain Road, and killed.

persons.name: Hector Gutierrez
persons.context: One of the four murder victims. He accompanied Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge, was held captive, transported to 419 Old Mountain Road, and killed.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed the filing as the prosecutor in the case.

connections.description: Tartaglione is accused of luring, confining, and killing Martin Luna as part of a drug trafficking conspiracy.
Tartaglione is accused of seizing, confining, and killing Urbano Santiago as part of a drug trafficking conspiracy.
Tartaglione is accused of seizing, confining, and killing Miguel Luna as part of a drug trafficking conspiracy.
Tartaglione is accused of seizing, confining, and killing Hector Gutierrez as part of a drug trafficking conspiracy.
Urbano Santiago accompanied Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge on April 11, 2016.
Miguel Luna accompanied Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge on April 11, 2016.
Hector Gutierrez accompanied Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge on April 11, 2016.
Berman, as the United States Attorney, is prosecuting the case against defendant Tartaglione.

events.title: Drug Trafficking Conspiracy Period
events.description: From at least 2015 through April 2016, Nicholas Tartaglione and others conspired to distribute and possess with intent to distribute 5 kilograms or more of cocaine.

events.title: Kidnapping and Murders at Likquid Lounge and Otisville
events.description: Tartaglione and others lured Martin Luna to the Likquid Lounge, confined him and three others (Urbano Santiago, Miguel Luna, Hector Gutierrez), then transported and killed Santiago, M. Luna, and Gutierrez at 419 Old Mountain Road. Martin Luna was killed at or near the Likquid Lounge.

events.title: Filing of Superseding Indictment
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office files a superseding indictment outlining aggravating factors to seek the death penalty against Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Murder and Kidnapping of Hector Gutierrez
events.description: The criminal acts involving the murder through use of a firearm and kidnapping resulting in death of Hector Gutierrez, which form the basis for the death penalty eligibility.

locations: Likquid Lounge, 69 Brookside Avenue, Chester, New York
419 Old Mountain Road, Otisville, New York
United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione is charged with a drug trafficking conspiracy involving 5+ kilograms of cocaine from 2015 to April 2016.
Tartaglione is accused of orchestrating the kidnapping and murder of four men (Martin Luna, Urbano Santiago, Miguel Luna, Hector Gutierrez) on or about April 11, 2016.
The alleged crimes occurred at two primary locations: the Likquid Lounge in Chester, NY, and a property at 419 Old Mountain Road in Otisville, NY.
The indictment includes charges for kidnapping resulting in death, murder in furtherance of a drug trafficking crime, and use of a firearm during a drug trafficking crime causing death.
The document is a superseding indictment, indicating it replaces or adds to a previous indictment in case number 7:16-cr-00832-KMK.
The U.S. government is seeking the death penalty against Nicholas Tartaglione for charges including murder and kidnapping resulting in death.
The murder and kidnapping of Hector Gutierrez are directly tied to a drug trafficking crime, forming the basis for federal capital charges.
Multiple statutory aggravating factors are listed, including substantial planning, premeditation, and intentionally killing more than one person in a single criminal episode.
The document is a formal superseding indictment filed in case number 7:16-cr-00832-KMK.
